Class Fireball

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.geom.RectangularShape
      • java.awt.geom.Rectangle2D
        • java.awt.geom.Rectangle2D.Double
          • MovingImage
            • Fireball
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.Shape, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable

    public class Fireball
extends MovingImage
    The Fireball class represents a fire ball which is a projectile that can be thrown.
    Version:
    5.23.21
    Author:
    alex_zheng
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • Fireball

        public Fireball(processing.core.PImage img,
                int x,
                int y,
                int w,
                int h,
                double vx,
                double vy)
        Creates a new instance of a Fireball object having its left corner at the inputed (x, y) coordinates with a specified width and height.
        Parameters:
        img - The PImage which the Fireball will look like in the game (sprite).
        x - The X value of the Fireball's top left corner.
        y - The Y value of the Fireball's top left corner.
        w - The width of the Fireball
        h - The height of the Fireball
        vx - The X component of the Fireball's velocity
        vy - The Y component of the Fireball's velocity

    • Method Detail

      • act

        public void act()
        Moves the Fireball according to its velocity.

        public boolean checkCollisionShape(java.util.ArrayList<java.awt.Shape> shapes)
        Check collision with platforms
        Parameters:
        shapes - platforms in game
        Returns:
        true if fireball collides with any platforms
